intro: Epidendrum chiriquense, commonly known as the Chiriquí orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family native to Central America. It is an epiphytic plant, typically growing on trees or rocks in humid, tropical environments. The plant produces striking, long-lasting inflorescences with brightly colored flowers, often in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Its roots are adapted to absorb moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. Epidendrum chiriquense is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in greenhouses or as a houseplant.
